item.title: The drama of hype technologies, customer needs, and pangs of conscience
item.description: We, programmers, sometimes choose to use certain technologies, methodologies, and approaches to problem-solving not because they provide the optimal solution, but simply because deep down, we want to mention them in our resumes. Such a choice very rarely leads to a positive result. The most powerful catalyst for any career will be grateful clients lining up in long queues to recommend you to others â€“ after all, you worked so hard for them. If this is true, it’s strange that they let you go. Client goodwill It will serve you much better than any trendy object of a trendy language and any trendy paradigm. Although it is very important (and even vital) for a software architect to stay updated on the latest trends and technologies, never try to broaden your horizons at the expense of the client.
